author: Diego Tudares
title: Hezbol√° es una milicia potente, m√°s de lo que deber√≠a por s√≠ sola
text:
Hezbol√° es una milicia potente, m√°s de lo que deber√≠a por s√≠ sola
En el convulsionado escenario de Oriente Pr√≥ximo, Hezbol√° se ha consolidado como uno de los actores no estatales m√°s influyentes y, sin duda, el mejor armado del mundo. A pesar de la abrumadora superioridad militar de Israel, que cuenta con uno de los ej√©rcitos m√°s poderosos y sofisticados del planeta, la milicia chi√≠ libanesa ha demostrado ser un adversario formidable. Sin embargo, su dualidad entre la resistencia y la amenaza plantea dilemas morales y pol√≠ticos que merecen ser analizados.
Uno de los aspectos m√°s destacables de Hezbol√° es su capacidad de presentar resistencia ante un enemigo abrumadoramente superior como Israel. A pesar de que la milicia no puede competir con las Fuerzas Armadas israel√≠es en t√©rminos de tecnolog√≠a militar o recursos econ√≥micos, ha logrado, a lo largo de las d√©cadas, desarrollar una estructura armada que combina guerra de guerrillas con t√°cticas de combate urbano. Esta estrategia ha permitido a Hezbol√° infligir da√±os considerables en los enfrentamientos directos con Israel, como se vio en la guerra de 2006.
Adem√°s, el grupo armado cuenta con una base de combatientes adoctrinados altamente motivados. Como se√±ala el analista Haizam Amirah Fern√°ndez, "sus miembros perciben el conflicto como una defensa de su tierra frente a un invasor extranjero". Esta narrativa de resistencia, profundamente enraizada en la identidad de la milicia, ha ganado el respaldo de gran parte de la comunidad chi√≠ del L√≠bano, que ve a Hezbol√° no solo como una milicia, sino como un defensor frente a la amenaza externa que representa Israel.
El respaldo de potencias como Ir√°n y Siria ha sido clave para que Hezbol√° se erija como una fuerza militar de gran capacidad. Gracias a estos aliados, ha acumulado un impresionante arsenal que incluye misiles de medio y largo alcance, capaces de alcanzar cualquier punto de Israel. Aunque la precisi√≥n y sofisticaci√≥n de estas armas no es comparable a las de las grandes potencias, su sola existencia plantea una amenaza latente para las infraestructuras cr√≠ticas israel√≠es y para los civiles.
La adquisici√≥n de misiles antitanques y sistemas de defensa a√©rea, aunque limitados en comparaci√≥n con la abrumadora superioridad israel√≠, demuestra la capacidad de Hezbol√° para adaptarse y mejorar su capacidad de disuasi√≥n. La implicaci√≥n de la milicia en la guerra civil siria tambi√©n le ha permitido adquirir experiencia en combate convencional, aumentando as√≠ su eficacia operativa.
Sin embargo, no todo en Hezbol√° puede verse a trav√©s del prisma de la resistencia. La organizaci√≥n ha sido acusada repetidamente de utilizar t√°cticas que ponen en riesgo a civiles, as√≠ como de promover una agenda pol√≠tica que perpet√∫a la inestabilidad en la regi√≥n. El uso de infraestructura civil, como redes de t√∫neles, para esconder armamento y lanzar ataques es una estrategia condenada por la comunidad internacional, pues pone en peligro a inocentes tanto dentro como fuera del L√≠bano.
Adem√°s, su dependencia del r√©gimen iran√≠ plantea interrogantes sobre su autonom√≠a. Si bien Hezbol√° ha capitalizado el resentimiento hacia Israel y la ocupaci√≥n del sur de L√≠bano en el pasado, su alineaci√≥n con los intereses de Teher√°n muestra que la milicia sirve m√°s como un brazo de la pol√≠tica exterior iran√≠ que como un verdadero defensor de los intereses libaneses. La participaci√≥n de Hezbol√° en la guerra en Siria, apoyando a un r√©gimen brutal como el de Bashar al-√Åsad, ha sido vista por civiles libaneses como una traici√≥n a los ideales de libertad y justicia que supuestamente defiende.
El creciente poder militar de Hezbol√° ha transformado el equilibrio en Oriente Pr√≥ximo. La milicia no solo representa una amenaza para Israel, sino que tambi√©n es un actor clave en la pol√≠tica interna libanesa, donde mantiene una influencia considerable. Su capacidad de movilizar tanto a combatientes como a recursos en tiempos de conflicto ha convertido a Hezbol√° en un jugador indispensable en la geopol√≠tica regional.
No obstante, este poder creciente tambi√©n ha atra√≠do cr√≠ticas. Para muchos, la existencia de una milicia tan poderosa dentro de un estado como el L√≠bano socava la soberan√≠a del pa√≠s y perpet√∫a un ciclo de dependencia militar y pol√≠tica. La influencia del grupo armado en la pol√≠tica libanesa ha sido vista como un obst√°culo para la estabilidad, especialmente en un pa√≠s que lucha por recuperarse de una crisis econ√≥mica y social sin precedentes.
A medida que las tensiones entre Israel y Hezbol√° contin√∫an escalando, la perspectiva de un conflicto a gran escala sigue siendo una posibilidad real. Sin embargo, tambi√©n es cierto que Hezbol√° ha sufrido p√©rdidas significativas en los √∫ltimos meses, lo que podr√≠a limitar su capacidad operativa en caso de una guerra prolongada. Si bien cuenta con una amplia reserva de armamento y combatientes, la pregunta es si podr√° sostener un conflicto prolongado contra un adversario tan poderoso como Israel.
A largo plazo, el desaf√≠o para el L√≠bano ser√° encontrar una manera de integrar a Hezbol√° en un marco m√°s institucional y democr√°tico, donde su poder militar no suponga una amenaza para la soberan√≠a del estado. Esto implicar√° no solo resolver las tensiones internas, sino tambi√©n abordar las din√°micas regionales que han permitido a Hezbol√° prosperar.
Hezbol√° encarna una compleja mezcla de resistencia y poder militar problem√°tico. Mientras que muchos lo ven como un defensor frente a la ocupaci√≥n israel√≠, otros lo perciben como un agente desestabilizador que solo responde a intereses externos. @mundiario

author: Emma Sanderson - Editor-in-Chief
title: Crete Migrant Rescue: 520 Saved From Drifting Boat
text:
Greece‚Äôs Shifting Shores: How Emergency Asylum Suspensions Foreshadow a New Era of Fortress Europe Over 520 individuals rescued in the Mediterranean Sea, coupled with Greece‚Äôs recent decision to temporarily suspend asylum applications from North African countries, isn‚Äôt merely a humanitarian crisis unfolding ‚Äì it‚Äôs a harbinger of a fundamental shift in Europe‚Äôs approach to migration. The escalating pressure on Greece, a key entry point, is forcing a re-evaluation of existing policies, and the ripple effects will be felt across the continent. **Migration policy** is entering a new, more restrictive phase, driven by political pressures and increasingly strained resources.
The Breaking Point: Crete and the Surge in Arrivals The immediate catalyst for Greece‚Äôs actions is the dramatic increase in migrant arrivals, particularly on the island of Crete. The sheer volume of rescues ‚Äì over 500 people in recent days alone ‚Äì has overwhelmed local infrastructure and sparked political debate. While humanitarian organizations rightly emphasize the duty to rescue and provide safe harbor, the Greek government faces mounting domestic pressure to control its borders and manage the influx. This isn‚Äôt simply a logistical challenge; it‚Äôs a political one, with far-right parties capitalizing on anxieties surrounding immigration.
Beyond Crete: A Pan-European Trend? Greece isn‚Äôt operating in a vacuum. Similar pressures are building in other frontline states like Italy and Spain. The suspension of asylum processing in Crete is likely to be viewed as a test case by other EU members contemplating similar measures. The EU‚Äôs existing asylum system, predicated on the Dublin Regulation (which generally assigns responsibility for asylum claims to the first country of entry), is demonstrably failing to distribute the burden equitably. This failure is fueling a growing sense of resentment among frontline states and a push for more national control over immigration policies.
The Rise of ‚ÄúExternalization‚Äù and the Shifting Geography of Asylum The Greek response signals a broader trend towards ‚Äúexternalization‚Äù of asylum processes ‚Äì attempting to manage migration flows *before* individuals reach European shores. This includes increased cooperation with North African countries to prevent departures, as well as exploring options for processing asylum claims in third countries. While proponents argue this is a more effective and humane approach, critics raise serious concerns about human rights abuses and the lack of due process in these externalized systems. The potential for creating a tiered system of asylum, where access to protection depends on nationality and origin, is a very real threat.
The Role of Geopolitics and Climate Change Underlying these immediate pressures are deeper, structural factors. Political instability in North Africa, exacerbated by climate change and economic hardship, is driving increased migration flows. As climate change intensifies, we can expect to see even greater displacement, creating a long-term and potentially unmanageable challenge for Europe. Ignoring these root causes and focusing solely on border control is a short-sighted and ultimately unsustainable strategy.
Year Migrant Arrivals to Greece (Approximate) 2015 850,000 2016 170,000 2023 43,000 2024 (Projected) 60,000+
The Future of Fortress Europe: Implications for Business and Security The hardening of Europe‚Äôs borders will have significant implications beyond humanitarian concerns. Increased border security measures will likely lead to higher costs for businesses reliant on migrant labor, particularly in sectors like agriculture and construction. Furthermore, the rise of anti-immigrant sentiment could fuel social unrest and political polarization, creating a less stable and predictable business environment. From a security perspective, the desperation of individuals denied asylum could drive them towards irregular channels, potentially increasing the risk of exploitation by criminal networks.
Frequently Asked Questions About European Migration Policy What is ‚Äúexternalization‚Äù of asylum processes? Externalization refers to the practice of processing asylum claims and managing migration flows outside of the EU‚Äôs borders, often in cooperation with third countries. This aims to prevent migrants from reaching Europe in the first place.
How will climate change impact migration to Europe? Climate change is expected to exacerbate existing drivers of migration, such as drought, famine, and conflict, leading to increased displacement and potentially larger migration flows towards Europe.
What are the potential consequences of suspending asylum applications? Suspending asylum applications raises serious legal and ethical concerns, potentially violating international law and leaving vulnerable individuals without access to protection.
Will other EU countries follow Greece‚Äôs lead? It‚Äôs highly likely. Greece‚Äôs actions are being closely watched by other frontline states facing similar pressures, and could encourage them to adopt more restrictive policies.
The situation in Greece is a stark warning. Europe is at a crossroads, and the choices it makes now will determine the future of its migration policies ‚Äì and, ultimately, its identity. The era of open borders is over, and a more restrictive, security-focused approach is taking hold. The question is whether Europe can navigate this transition in a way that upholds its humanitarian values and addresses the root causes of migration.
What are your predictions for the future of European migration policy? Share your insights in the comments below!
topics: Disaster and Accident->transportation accident and incident

author: archyde
title: England Triumphs Over West Indies in Thrilling Second Test Showdown
text:
England defeated the West Indies by 113 runs in the second Test and avenged the defeat in the first Test.
In the second Test starting July 16 in Manchester, the visiting West Indies won the toss and decided to field first, which proved to be heavy.
The host England scored 469 runs for the loss of 9 wickets in the first innings thanks to the excellent batting of Ben Stokes and Subley and declared the innings.
Ben Stokes played a brilliant innings of 176 and Subley 120 runs.
The West Indies team was bowled out for 287 runs in the first innings in response to England. Brathwaite, Brooks and Chase were the only notables for the Black Wind who played 75, 68 and 51 runs respectively.
On behalf of England, Broad and Woakes took 3, 3 and Curran dismissed 2 players and thus the host team got a lead of 182 runs in the first innings.
Ben Stokes and Buttler opened the second innings for England and once again Stokes batted brilliantly.
In the second innings too, England scored 129 runs for the loss of 3 wickets and declared the innings and gave the visiting team a target of 311 runs to win.
Ben Stokes remained unbeaten on 78 runs.
In the second innings, the West Indian team could score 198 runs in pursuit of 312 runs and faced defeat by 113 runs.
Ben Stokes scored a total of 254 runs and took 3 wickets in the match and was declared Man of the Match for this outstanding performance.
It should be noted that West Indies defeated England in the first test of the series and now the decisive third test will be played in Manchester from July 24.
With this win, England leveled the three-Test series at 1-1.
West Indies‚Äô Brooks scored 62 and Jermaine Blackwood scored 55 runs, Stuart Broad took 3, Ben Stokes, Dom Bess and Chris Woakes took 2 and 2 wickets respectively for the host team.
#England #defeated #West #Indies #Test
2024-09-05 20:12:12

This clash, which commenced on July 16, proved to be a significant moment for ‚Å£the English team‚Äç as they regrouped and redefined ‚Å§their game strategy to secure a dominant win.
The First Innings: England Sets a Mammoth Target The West Indies, winning the toss, opted to field first, a decision‚Å£ that would later be scrutinized. England capitalized on the opportunity, amassing an impressive total of 469 runs for the loss of 9‚Å¢ wickets in their first innings. The standout performers for ‚Å£England were none other‚Äå than Ben Stokes ‚Å§and Dom Sibley , who both‚Å£ delivered stellar performances at the crease.
Ben Stokes and Dom ‚Å£Sibley Shine Ben Stokes, the talismanic all-rounder,‚Äå played a remarkable innings, scoring 176 runs before being dismissed. His aggressive yet calculated batting was the‚Äå cornerstone of England‚Äôs innings. Dom Sibley also made a significant contribution ‚Äçwith a well-crafted 120 runs ,‚Äå helping England build a substantial‚Äå total. The pair‚Äôs partnership not only frustrated ‚Äåthe West Indian bowlers but also laid the foundation for a commanding position.
West Indies‚Äô Struggle in Response In reply, the West Indies team faltered, managing to score ‚Å¢just 287 runs in their first innings. The batting lineup‚Äã struggled against‚Äå a disciplined English bowling attack led‚Å£ by Stuart Broad and Chris Woakes , ‚Äåboth of whom claimed three wickets apiece. ‚Å¢ Sam Curran ‚Å§ also chipped in with two wickets, ensuring that the West Indies could not‚Å§ mount a sturdy resistance.
Notable Performances For the West Indies,‚Å¢ only a few batters managed to make notable contributions, with ‚Äç Kraigg Brathwaite leading ‚Å£the ‚Äçcharge with 75 runs . Shai Hope ‚Å§ and Roston Chase also chipped in with 68 and 51 ‚Äãruns respectively, but it was ‚Å£not enough to bridge the gap. England‚Äôs first-innings ‚Äçlead ‚Äçswelled to an impressive 182 runs , setting‚Äç the stage for their second ‚Äçinnings declaration.
Second Innings:‚Äå England Builds an Insurmountable Target With a‚Äã healthy lead, England took to the crease again, looking to set a daunting target for the West Indies. Openers Ben Stokes and Jos‚Å¢ Buttler launched the‚Äã second innings successfully, scoring 129 runs for ‚Äãthe‚Å¢ loss of 3 wickets before once again declaring their innings. Ben Stokes continued his brilliant ‚Å§form, remaining unbeaten‚Å¢ on 78 runs .
The target was‚Äã set at 311 runs , ‚Äãa challenging feat for the West Indies, especially given their previous batting struggles.
The Final Attempt: West Indies Fall Short In their second innings, the West Indies aimed to achieve the seemingly insurmountable target of 312 runs but were ultimately‚Å¢ bowled out for 198 runs . The English bowlers maintained their ‚Äçrhythm, ‚Äåwith Curran and Woakes once again leading the‚Å£ charge, while Broad provided ‚Å¢crucial breakthroughs when ‚Å¢needed.
Conclusion This match not only ‚Äåshowcased England‚Äôs depth and talent but also highlighted the resilience of Ben Stokes, who played a pivotal‚Äå role in both innings. His overall‚Å¢ contribution was‚Äç significant, as ‚Å¢he amassed a total of 254 runs ‚Å£in the match, reaffirming his ‚Å£status as one of the leading all-rounders in contemporary cricket.
England‚Äôs victory ‚Äãby 113 runs in the second‚Å§ Test against the West Indies was a testament to their‚Äå skill, strategy, and determination to bounce back after their ‚Äãprevious loss. This match will undoubtedly be remembered as a‚Å§ turning point in the series, with‚Å§ England ‚Äãlooking‚Äã to build on this momentum‚Äå moving forward.

author: Cal Thomas, Syndicated columnist
title: Cal Thomas: The new American antisemitism
text:
In the aftermath of ‚Äúfrom the river to the sea‚Äù anti-Israel protests on many college campuses and in the streets comes a perfectly timed book by Johns Hopkins University Professor Benjamin Ginsberg titled ‚ÄúThe New American Anti-Semitism: The Left, The Right, and the Jews.‚Äù
Professor Ginsberg is especially hard on progressives and urges American Jews to move away from their longtime support of Democrats to form a new political alliance, especially with evangelical Christians.
While U.S. presidents have given lip service in support of Israel ‚Äî and yes, the Jewish people and their ancestral homeland cannot be separated ‚Äî in practice, some Republican and many Democratic presidents have pressured Israel to make concessions to her sworn enemies that would spell the death of the Jewish state.
In Israel‚Äôs ongoing attempt to eliminate Hamas in Gaza, Politico reports: ‚ÄúBiden administration officials have spent weeks quietly drafting a multiphase postwar game plan that envisions a revamped Palestinian Authority (PA) ultimately taking over the Gaza Strip.‚Äù
People are also reading‚Ä¶
It takes a leap of faith to ignore what Hamas and other terrorist groups have as their objective and to believe that a ‚Äúrevamped‚Äù PA would not be overtaken again by Hamas, or another terror group.
Antisemitism extends back to ancient Egypt. The explanations are familiar ‚Äî from the ‚Äúchosen people‚Äù reference in Scripture, to blaming Jews for ‚Äúkilling Christ.‚Äù
Ginsberg gets to what I think is the real source of antisemitism. He writes that because of the Jewish peoples‚Äô rigorous emphasis on education and achievements, Jews often rise to the upper echelons of the societies in which they live. And yet, he says, such success breeds resentment and jealousy. Underachievers need someone to blame and for some this tiny minority is an easy target.
In view of this, Ginsberg wonders why a large majority of Jews still vote for Democrats. ‚ÄúSince 1932,‚Äù he writes, ‚ÄúJews have unfailingly given a plurality of their votes to Democratic presidential candidates. ‚Ä¶ On seven occasions (they) received more than 80 percent of the Jewish vote.‚Äù
Jews were once mostly loyal to Republicans, but since Franklin Roosevelt their allegiance has shifted. Given Roosevelt‚Äôs barring of thousands of Jewish refugees from entering the country (the excuse was they might be Nazi spies) and his refusal to bomb the rail lines leading to Auschwitz, their continued support of Democrats is hard to fathom.
While Jews largely voted for and supported Roosevelt, in part because the president had so many Jews in high government positions, Ginsberg writes, ‚Äúthe president was leery of being identified too closely with Jews. FDR asked his Jewish advisors to keep a low profile.‚Äù
During the ‚Äúred scare‚Äù of the McCarthy era, many of those accused of communist sympathies or membership in the Communist Party, especially in Hollywood, were Jews.
Modern antisemitism is egged-on by members of ‚ÄúThe Squad‚Äù in Congress. One of those members, Rep. Ilhan Omar, D-Minn., has equated the United States and Israel with Hamas and the Taliban. That was too much for some of her Democratic colleagues, who denounced her comments.
College campuses appear to be breeding grounds for modern antisemitism. A survey by the Anti-Defamation League found ‚Äú73% of Jewish college students surveyed have experienced or witnessed some form of antisemitism since the beginning of the 2023-2024 school year alone. ‚Ä¶ Of the non-Jewish students erroneously assumed to be Jewish, nearly half (46%) stated that they had been targeted based on their assumed Jewishness.‚Äù
The worldwide media fuels some of this by either adopting a moral equivalency position between Israel and her enemies, failing to report on Islamic leaders who claim a religious mandate to eliminate Israel and exterminate Jews, and slanting their coverage in favor of the Palestinians.
Ginsberg‚Äôs book should be required reading for those who are unclear about the roots of antisemitism and how Jewish-hatred continues to poison the politics and culture of many countries, including our own.

author: Mariam Abdullahi
title: My Remarkable Escape from Death in the A‚ÄôIbom Church Collapse ‚Äì Deputy Governor
text:
Surviving a dire situation seven years ago, the Deputy Governor of Akwa Ibom State, Senator Akon Eyakenyi, shared her harrowing experience of narrowly escaping death during the collapse of the Reigners Bible Internal Bible Church in Uyo.
Tragedy struck on December 10, 2016, as the church crumbled during the ordination ceremony of the senior pastor, Akan Weeks, resulting in numerous casualties and injuries.
Even the then Governor Udom Emmanuel narrowly evaded death during the catastrophic event.
Recounting the incident at her daughter‚Äôs wedding in Uyo, Eyakenyi revealed that her timely exit from the building moments before the collapse likely saved her life.
She disclosed that the area where she had been seated inside the church was severely affected by the collapse.
‚ÄúBlessing (my daughter) was nurtured by another set of parents during her upbringing ‚Äì the former Governor of Akwa Ibom State, Mr. Udom Gabriel Emmanuel, and his wife, Martha Udom Emmanuel.
‚ÄúWhile Blessing pursued her Master‚Äôs degree in the US, the former governor and his wife assumed responsibility for her welfare, overseeing her education until her return to Nigeria. It was a significant sacrifice.‚Äù
‚ÄúI owe my survival to the former governor‚Äôs selfless act. On the fateful day of December 10, 2016, it was a portion of the tuition fees he bore that led me out of the collapsing church, mere moments before its collapse.
‚ÄúThe section where I had been seated suffered grave injuries, but I was spared. I attribute my continued existence to his intervention. I am truly grateful,‚Äù expressed the deputy governor.
She extended her gratitude to Governor Umo Eno for his unwavering support towards her and her family, acknowledging his significant role in their lives.
‚ÄúThe governor has been instrumental in showering blessings upon my family and the children present here today. Words fall short in expressing my appreciation for everything he has done,
‚ÄúI want to sincerely thank him. May he and his wife be blessed abundantly,‚Äù concluded Eyakenyi.

author: Ny MaGee
title: Ice T and Wife Coco Austin Celebrate 23 Years of Marriage: ‚ÄòIt Gets Better Every Year‚Äô
text: *Ice T and his wife, Coco Austin, rang in the new year celebrating their 23rd anniversary. The old-school rapper [posted a #throwback photo](https://www.instagram.com/p/C1h7SHwuZ0i/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link) of himself with his longtime love, and he captioned it, ‚ÄúToday is Coco and my 23rd Anniversary!‚Äù he wrote. ‚ÄúKeep it fun, Keep it sexy, and by all means ‚ÄòStay in LOVE!‚Äô It just gets better every year.‚Äù A separate post shows the couple celebrating the new year. Ice-T [captioned the sexy image](https://www.instagram.com/p/C1lFikkOcSY/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link&igsh=MzRlODBiNWFlZA==): ‚ÄúCoco and I kept it Sexy as usual for NewYearsEve and our 23rd Anniversary! [@treachtribe](https://www.instagram.com/treachtribe/) and I kept it Gangster.üí• I wish nothing but the BEST for all of you! Stay healthy and make 2024 your year.‚Äù Some social media users responded with hateful comments about Coco‚Äôs sexy attire in the images, prompting the ‚ÄúLaw & Order: Special Victims Unit‚Äù star to [issue a statement on X/Twiter](https://x.com/FINALLEVEL/status/1742338116860739885?s=20) that read, ‚ÄúSo far this New Year I‚Äôve got nothing but Love from everyone! ‚ù§Ô∏è Of course a couple a females Hating on Coco‚Ä¶ I decided to just Block and not even acknowledge the miserable bitches‚Ä¶‚Äù Austin posted a picture from their [2011 vow renewal ceremony](https://www.instagram.com/p/C1iI70HrioY/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link&igsh=MzRlODBiNWFlZA==) on New Year‚Äôs Day. She captioned the image: ‚ÄúHere‚Äôs to 23 years with this guy!! My rock! My diamond in the rough! Love you beyond [#HappyAnniversary](https://www.instagram.com/explore/tags/happyanniversary/) [#HappyNewYear2024](https://www.instagram.com/explore/tags/happynewyear2024/) [#nowordscandescribe](https://www.instagram.com/explore/tags/nowordscandescribe/).‚Äù View this post on Instagram Ice-T spoke about the vow renewal in a 2023 interview with [People](https://people.com/ice-t-shares-favorite-las-vegas-wedding-memory-with-coco-austin-7968216#:~:text=%22We%20never%20really%20told%20anybody,We%20didn't.). ‚ÄúWe made an agreement that we would renew the vows in five years. We didn‚Äôt. We did it in 10 years on Ice Loves Coco. We had a big thing in L.A. and it was better, because we had been married 10 years,‚Äù Ice-T told the outlet. Ice and Coco married in 2002 and have one minor daughter. author: Timber Schuman
title: 456 Avalanches tumble through Colorado last week
text:
KREX articles 456 Avalanches tumble through Colorado last week Timber Schuman Fri, January 3, 2025 at 1:15 AM UTC 1 min read
GRAND JUNCTION, Colo. ( KREX ) ‚Äî Colorado is known for its abundance of mountains, like the Grand Mesa in our backyard. However, with towering views and thick forests comes a more sinister possibility.
Colorado Avalanche Information Center Director Ethan Greene tells WesternSlopeNow there have been 456 avalanches throughout the state just within this past week.
Greene states the Grand Mesa is sitting at an avalanche risk of about a level two out of a five-point scale. Places like the flat tops outside of Meeker are sitting at a level three.
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Seventeen people were caught in 15 avalanches this season already, all of which have gotten lucky and made it out alive.
He says not to worry about the safety of your winter sports since the snowpack inside ski areas versus outside is quite different.
If you do plan to explore the backcountry, Greene suggests checking colorado.gov/avalanche to see current conditions.
What should you carry through avalanche country? There are three main essentials ‚Äì an avalanche rescue transceiver, a probe pole and a shovel.
Salesperson at Gearhead Outfitters Mikayla Herrara showed WesternSlopeNow what an avalanche transceiver looks like. It‚Äôs a smaller device you wear on the outside of your body, like on a backpack strap. She says beacons can cost anywhere from $200 to $400.
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Greene tells WesternSlopeNow avalanches form by weak layers of snow made by calm periods of weather. Once more snow falls on top, it creates a thick, heavy slab that can slide off of the weak layer.
If you plan to go out to explore the wonderful backyard Colorado has to offer, stay vigilant and bring these essentials. Avalanche season is far from over.

For the latest news, weather, sports, and streaming video, head to WesternSlopeNow.com.

author: @zazoomblog

text:

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Father Joe‚Äôs Served Nearly 4,000 People During January Storms, Report Finds
text:
By Debbie L. Sklar ,
2 hours ago The interior of the tent for homeless at Father Joe‚Äôs Villages. Courtesy of Father Joe‚Äôs Father Joe‚Äôs Villages, San Diego‚Äôs largest homelessness services provider, served nearly 4,000 neighbors in need in January, including inclement weather shelter during recent unprecedented rainstorms, a report released Thursday by the nonprofit revealed.
This represented 28,506 shelter bed nights ‚Äî defined as one person sleeping in a safe shelter for one night ‚Äî during and following the Jan. 22 storms and flooding.
Father Joe‚Äôs latest ‚ÄúCompassion in Action: Our Neighbors by the Numbers‚Äù monthly report includes data on the number of people experiencing homelessness in January. Father Joe‚Äôs Villages‚Äô medical staff also provided care to 1,015 neighbors last month through Street Health, dentistry, mental health and psychiatric care. The organization also helped 36 individuals find housing and exit homelessness.
‚ÄúMany of our neighbors in need experience homelessness all year ‚Äî including during historic storms and inclement weather,‚Äù said Deacon Jim Vargas, president and CEO of Father Joe‚Äôs Villages. ‚ÄúThis is precisely why we offer our wraparound services and emergency shelter options every day.
‚ÄúThe homelessness crisis doesn‚Äôt take a day off for bad weather, so we don‚Äôt either,‚Äù Vargas said.
The monthly reports are intended to help the organization allocate resources to meet the needs of the communities it serves.
‚Äî City News Service

author: Ben Pope
title: Blackhawks' Ryan Donato finding rhythm by shooting and forechecking after long slump - Chicago Sun-Times
text: After long slump, Blackhawks‚Äô Ryan Donato finding rhythm by shooting and forechecking The journeyman forward has scored three times in the Hawks‚Äô last six games after going 26 straight without a goal, although he admits it would feel better if the games were actually meaningful to the playoff race. On March 2, when Blackhawks forward Ryan Donato was positioned perfectly in the slot, received a centering pass and flubbed his shot wide, he felt like he would never score again. He had gone 26 consecutive games without hitting the net, keeping him stuck on six goals for the season after depositing 14 and 16 the last two years in Seattle. Later that same game against the Blue Jackets , however, his luck finally changed. As he followed up a Philipp Kurashev one-man rush, the puck bounced off the end-wall right in front of him, and he simply tapped it across the line beneath the goaltender. Suddenly, he had not a 26-game goalless streak but a one-game scoring streak. "It's funny [how] you get one in the net and things start to change, right?" Donato said Thursday. "You can look at Connor [Bedard] for an example. He had that one [drought], and he gets one that sneaks in and he catches fire." Donato's recent surge since that lucky bounce hasn't been quite as dramatic as Bedard's, but the 27-year-old journeyman has nonetheless played his best hockey of the season over the past few weeks. He now touts three goals in his last six games and six points in his last eight. "Even before he scored over the last few games, he was just skating better," coach Luke Richardson said. "He was more determined. He was just free. At some point [during a slump], you get to the point where you just forget about it and just play, and I think that's what he did." Richardson has particularly liked Donato's trigger-happy shooting and physical forechecking. He has a very good shot, and although he hasn't shown it as much as hoped this season, he does rank third on the team with 30 shot attempts during the last six games ‚Äî behind only Bedard and Seth Jones. His goal Sunday against the Coyotes was an especially pretty top-corner snipe. Earlier on Sunday, however, he made just as much of an impact on a shift on which he didn't score. Instead, he singlehandedly led two forechecks, beating Coyotes goalie Connor Ingram to a dumped-in puck and then delivering a crushing hit on Coyotes defenseman J.J. Moser. The hit on Moser woke up a sleepy crowd and forced a clearance that gave the Hawks possession. Twenty-two seconds later, Bedard scored the Hawks' first goal in their comeback win . Richardson called it one of Donato's best performances of the season. Donato admits he would feel better about his late-season resurgence if the Hawks were in the playoff race and these games truly mattered, but he's also glad the team as a whole has played better lately. The more offensive-zone time they have, the more opportunities he and his teammates have to make positive contributions. As one of the team's most religious players, he thinks the Hawks spending so much time in Chicago lately ‚Äî enabling him to attend church more frequently ‚Äî has helped, too. "I just keep on praying that, if [I] do the hard work, things will go well for [me]," he said. "Right now, things seem to be going that way."
